middleware.name: lwip
middleware.desc:
lwIP is a small independent open source implementation of the TCP/IP protocol suite. Using this library in a project will cause lwIP to be downloaded on your computer. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the lwIP license.
Additional Information:
  • lwIP Library Information
  • lwIP Repo Information

middleware.name: wifi-host-driver
middleware.desc:
Wi-Fi Host Driver(WHD) is an independent, embedded Wi-Fi Host Driver that provides a set of APIs to interact with Infineon WLAN chips. It is the low level driver required for any library or application that uses WiFi connectivity.
Additional Information:
  • WiFi Host Driver README.md
  • WiFi Host Driver RELEASE.md
  • Wi-Fi Host Driver API Reference Manual and Porting Guide

middleware.name: wifi-mw-core
middleware.desc:
Wi-Fi Middleware Core library comprises core components needed for Wi-Fi connectivity support. The library bundles FreeRTOS, lwIP TCP/IP stack, and mbed TLS for security, Wi-Fi Host Driver (WHD), Secure Sockets interface, configuration files, and associated code to bind these components together.
Additional Information:
  • Wi-Fi Middleware Core Library README.md
  • Wi-Fi Middleware Core Library RELEASE.md
  • Wi-Fi Middleware Core Library API reference guide

middleware.name: wifi-core-freertos-lwip-mbedtls
middleware.desc:
Wi-Fi core freertos lwip mbedtls bundle library comprises core components needed for Wi-Fi connectivity support. The library bundles FreeRTOS, lwIP TCP/IP stack, and mbed TLS for security, Wi-Fi Host Driver (WHD), Wi-Fi connection manager, Secure Sockets interface, and configuration files.
Additional Information:
  • Wi-Fi core freertos lwip mbedtls bundle library README.md
  • Wi-Fi core freertos lwip mbedtls bundle library RELEASE.md

middleware.name: lwip-network-interface-integration
middleware.desc:
lwIP network interface integration library is an integration layer that links lwIP network stack with underlying Wi-Fi Host Driver(WHD) and Ethernet driver. This library interacts with FreeRTOS, lwIP TCP/IP stack, and mbed TLS for security, Wi-Fi host driver (WHD) and Ethernet Driver.
Additional Information:
  • lwIP network interface integration library README.md
  • lwIP network interface integration library RELEASE.md
  • lwIP network interface integration library API reference guide

middleware.name: lwip-freertos-integration
middleware.desc:
lwIP FreeRTOS integration library contains the FreeRTOS dependancies needed by the Lightweight open-source TCP/IP stack, version: 2.1.2 to execute.
Additional Information:
  • lwIP FreeRTOS integration library README.md
  • lwIP FreeRTOS integration library RELEASE.md

middleware.name: secure-sockets
middleware.desc:
Secure Sockets library provides APIs to create software that can send and/or receive data over the network using sockets. This library supports both secure and non-secure sockets, and abstracts the complexity involved in directly using network stack and security stack APIs. This library supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing modes for UDP and TCP sockets.
Additional Information:
  • Secure Sockets Library README.md
  • Secure Sockets Library RELEASE.md
  • Secure Sockets Library API reference guide

middleware.name: lpa
middleware.desc:
LPA is Low power assistant middleware library which provides easy way to configure and use low power features of Infineon devices PSoC™ 6 MCU + Wi-Fi & Bluetooth® combo chip. Please see current documentation for currently supported devices.
Additional Information:
  • LPA README.md
  • LPA RELEASE.md
  • LPA API reference guide

middleware.name: wifi-cert
middleware.desc:
WiFi Cert Tester library used by WiFi Cert Tester tool running on a PSoC™ 6 MCU with CYW4343W or CYW43012 Wi-Fi & Bluetooth® combo chip. WiFi Cert Tester library is used for Wi-Fi certification of 11n-PSK, 11n WPA2 Enterprise, PMF, WPA3 and 11ac. Please see current documentation for currently supported devices.
Additional Information:
  • WiFi Cert Middleware Library README.md
  • WiFi Cert Middleware RELEASE.md
  • WiFi Cert API reference guide

middleware.name: wpa3-external-supplicant
middleware.desc:
The WPA3 External Supplicant supports WPA3 SAE authentication using HnP (Hunting and Pecking Method) using RFC https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7664 and H2E ( Hash to Element Method) using RFC https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-irtf-cfrg-hash-to-curve-10 and following 802.11 spec 2016.
Additional Information:
  • WPA3 External Supplicant Library README.md
  • WPA3 External Supplicant RELEASE.md

middleware.name: wifi-mfg-test
middleware.desc:
WiFi manufacturing test library is used by WiFi Mfg tester tool running on PSoC™ 6 MCU + WiFi & Bluetooth® combo devices. The application should be run in tandem with the host based 'wl' tool running on Windows 10 machines. This test tool is used to validate WLAN firmware and WLAN radio performance. Refer to the documentation for currently supported devices.
Additional Information:
  • WiFi Mfg Test Middleware Library README.md
  • WiFi Mfg Test Middleware RELEASE.md
  • WiFi Mfg Test API reference guide

middleware.name: wifi-connection-manager
middleware.desc:
Wi-Fi Connection Manager (WCM) library helps application developers to manage Wi-Fi Connectivity. The library provides a set of APIs that can be used to establish and monitor Wi-Fi connections on PSoC™ 6 MCU based platforms with connectivity. The library APIs are thread-safe. The library monitors the Wi-Fi connection and can notifies connection state changes through an event notification mechanism. The library also provides APIs to connect to a Wi-Fi network using Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) methods.
Additional Information:
  • Wi-Fi Connection Manager Library README.md
  • Wi-Fi Connection Manager Library RELEASE.md
  • Wi-Fi Connection Manager Library API reference guide

middleware.name: http-server
middleware.desc:
This library provides the HTTP Server implementation that can work on the PSoC™ 6 MCU based platforms with network connectivity. It supports RESTful methods such as GET, PUT, and POST for the client to communicate with this HTTP Server library.
Additional Information:
  • HTTP Server Library README.md
  • HTTP Server Library RELEASE.md
  • HTTP Server Library API reference guide

middleware.name: mqtt
middleware.desc:
This MQTT client library works with the family of PSoC™ 6 MCU based connectivity platforms. This library uses the AWS IoT Device SDK MQTT Client library and implements the glue layer that is required for the library to work with PSoC™ 6 MCU based platforms with network connectivity.
Additional Information:
  • MQTT Client Library README.md
  • MQTT Client Library RELEASE.md
  • MQTT Client Library API reference guide

middleware.name: http-client
middleware.desc:
This library provides the HTTP Client implementation that can work on the PSoC™ 6 MCU based platforms with network connectivity. This library supports RESTful methods such as GET, PUT, POST, and HEAD to communicate with the HTTP Server.
Additional Information:
  • HTTP Client Library README.md
  • HTTP Client Library RELEASE.md
  • HTTP Client Library API reference guide

middleware.name: aws-iot-device-sdk-port
middleware.desc:
This library contains the port layer implementation for the MQTT and HTTP Client libraries to work with the AWS-IoT-Device-SDK-Embedded-C library on PSoC™ 6 MCU based platforms with network connectivity. This library APIs are not expected to be called by application directly. See the MQTT and HTTP Client library documentation for more details. Using this library in a project will cause AWS-IoT-Device-SDK-Embedded-C library to be downloaded on your computer. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the AWS-IoT-Device-SDK-Embedded-C license.
Additional Information:
  • AWS IoT Device SDK Port Library README.md
  • AWS IoT Device SDK Port Library RELEASE.md
  • AWS IoT Device SDK Port Library API reference guide

middleware.name: azure-c-sdk-port
middleware.desc:
This library implements the port layer for the Azure SDK for Embedded C to work on PSoC™ 6 MCU based platforms with network connectivity. This library automatically pulls the Azure SDK for Embedded C library; the port layer functions implemented by this library are used by the Azure SDK for Embedded C library. If application needs Azure SDK for Embedded C library with MQTT client functionality, it needs to explicitly import MQTT library. Refer README.md located in ./sample_app/README.md for additional information.
Additional Information:
  • Azure C SDK Port Library README.md
  • Azure C SDK Port Library RELEASE.md
  • Azure C SDK Port Library API reference guide

middleware.name: smartcoex
middleware.desc:
This library provides an API that user can use to configure the coex parameters for WLAN and Bluetooth® Low Energy on PSoC™ 6 MCU based platforms with Wi-Fi & Bluetooth® combo chip. Refer to the links give below for details.
Additional Information:
  • Smart Coex Library README.md
  • Smart Coex Library RELEASE.md
  • Smart Coex Library API reference guide

middleware.name: enterprise-security
middleware.desc:
This library provides the capability for best in class Wi-Fi enabled PSoC™ 6 devices to connect to enterprise Wi-Fi networks. This library implements a collection of the most commonly used Extensible Authentication Protocols (EAP) that are used in enterprise networks.
Additional Information:
  • Enterprise Security Library README.md
  • Enterprise Security Library RELEASE.md
  • Enterprise Security Library API reference guide

middleware.name: anycloud-ota
middleware.desc:
The OTA library provides support for Over-The-Air update of the application code running on a PSoC™ 6 MCU with AIROC™ CYW4343W or CYW43012 Wi-Fi & Bluetooth® combo chip, using Wi-Fi or Bluetooth®. Please see current documentation for currently supported devices. OTA requires the use of mcuboot
Additional Information:
  • OTA API README.md
  • OTA API reference guide
  • MCUboot documentation

middleware.name: command-console
middleware.desc:
This library provides a framework to add command console support to the application (or) product usecases. Wi-Fi, iPerf and Bluetooth® Low Energy command support are bundled with this library.
Additional Information:
  • Command Console Library README.md
  • Command Console Library RELEASE.md
  • Command Console Library API reference guide

middleware.name: ota-update
middleware.desc:
The OTA library provides support for Over-The-Air update of the application code running on a PSoC 6 MCU with AIROC CYW4343W or CYW43012 Wi-Fi & Bluetooth combo chip, using Wi-Fi or Bluetooth. Please see current documentation for currently supported devices. OTA requires the use of mcuboot.
Additional Information:
  • OTA API README.md
  • OTA API reference guide
  • MCUboot documentation
